questions.question: When I said work hours should be reduced I was speaking ............................. all employees.
questions.description: To speak for is to speak on somebody's behalf.

questions.question: The restaurant gets really crowded in the evenings. Be sure to speak ................................... a table.
questions.description: To speak for a table is to reserve it.

questions.question: She is a fabulous writer. Her stories speak ................................... themselves.
questions.description: When a story speaks for itself, it represents a certain quality.

questions.question: I am speaking ................................ myself, not for my colleagues.
questions.description: To speak for yourself is to speak on your behalf.

questions.question: This act speaks .................................... his generosity.
questions.description: Speak of can mean indicate or suggest.

questions.question: You should learn to speak ................................. your opinion.
questions.description: To speak out your opinion is to assert it.

questions.question: Her songs really speak ................................. me.
questions.description: If something speaks to you, it resonates with you.

questions.question: Please speak .................................. I can't hear you properly.
questions.description: To speak up is to talk more loudly.

questions.question: No one speaks ..................................... for the oppressed.
I found his behavior unacceptable but I didn’t dare to speak ……………………….. about it.
If this happens again, you have to speak ………………………… him.
Last few months have been very dry – no rain to speak …………………………..
